title: Variation-selection-retention: quality-outcome linkage

retention_state.note: 7 retained mutations found vs 1 at S186 — but all 7 are DOMEX-GEN READY (stale dispatch lanes, not executed mutations). True executed retention rate is still ~0.10.

phase_analysis.driver: expect-act-diff wiring, F121/F122 bulk frontier work

quality_vs_retained_mutation.finding: sessions with active retained lanes (S184-S185, UNDERSTAND-SWARM) both scored 0.00 quality — orientation is necessary but not quality-generating
quality_vs_retained_mutation.conclusion: Retention rate alone is not a quality predictor. Quality predicts retention (high-quality patterns get reused) but not the reverse.

protocol_mutation_coupling.interpretation: Protocol mutation is now POSITIVELY correlated with both quality and frontier advances in the recent window — a phase shift from S186 findings where mutation was purely a stability cost. The S178-S188 protocol evolution cluster was productive.

binding_constraint_analysis.finding: Throughput (1.5%) is the critical bottleneck. 128 READY lanes represent stalled demand — they were dispatched but never executed. This is not a production problem but a delivery problem.
binding_constraint_analysis.implication: Swarm is producing knowledge faster than it is acting on it — a supply-demand imbalance in the task economy.

sessions_S189_S200_forecast.quality_trend: plateau expected at 2.5-3.5 Sharpe as domain experiments ship; recovers if >=3 domain frontiers resolve
sessions_S189_S200_forecast.lesson_rate: acceleration (8x) will normalize to 3-4 L/session as domain seeding phase ends
sessions_S189_S200_forecast.binding_constraint_shift: throughput bottleneck (READY lanes) becomes dominant risk if not addressed by S192
sessions_S189_S200_forecast.protocol_mutation_outlook: productive phase continues for ~5-8 more sessions, then stability guardrails become necessary as destabilization correlation (0.67) may catch up

critical_phase_transitions.trigger: 17 seeded domains need first experiments; currently 37 unrun
critical_phase_transitions.quality_impact: +2-4 Sharpe per domain that ships a resolved frontier

critical_phase_transitions.trigger: READY backlog reaches 150+ lanes or throughput drops below 1%
critical_phase_transitions.quality_impact: risk of quality collapse to 0.0 if stall deepens
needs explicit stability guardrails (protocol mutation firebreak)

prescriptions: PRIORITY-1: Convert READY→DONE or READY→ABANDONED for 80+ READY lanes (throughput bottleneck, not knowledge bottleneck)
PRIORITY-2: Execute 3+ domain experiments per session (not more seeding) to recover quality burst potential
PRIORITY-3: Wire protocol mutation firebreak: if destabilization_r > 0.75, hold protocol mutations for 3 sessions
PRIORITY-4: Quality predicts retention (not reverse) — identify this session's high-quality work and mark as reuse candidates

f_evo1_diversity_link.finding: High diversity ratio (0.81) with high HHI (0.79) is paradoxical — many unique scope-keys but most events concentrate on few (NEXT.md, tools/). True diversity = more equal distribution across scopes.
f_evo1_diversity_link.prescription: Rebalance lane allocation: cap tasks/NEXT.md events at 20% of session lanes

vsf_closure_status.variation: CONFIRMED — 17 unique scope channels per session (S186 baseline)
vsf_closure_status.selection: CONFIRMED — selection rate 1.0 (all lanes eventually close)
vsf_closure_status.retention: WEAK — 0.10 retention rate, executed retention (multi-session base patterns) is sparse
vsf_closure_status.quality_linkage: NOW RESOLVED: retention does not cause quality; quality causes retention. Causal direction inverted from original hypothesis.
vsf_closure_status.f_evo2_status: PARTIAL→NEAR-RESOLVED: VSR operational; quality-linkage causal direction established; remains open for quality-predictor validation
